Doug,  There is an excellent article written by Dr.Takeuchi 
concerning his=
tory of the term Wakizashi.  Simply Google " 
Historical Classification of =
Wakizashi."  I'm sure you will find it 
informative.  I also recall reading=
 other material which indicated 
swords forged of the length between 1 and =
2 shaku from the (approx.) 
time period of 1200 to 1400 AD are "very few" i=
n number.  After 1400 
AD there were many.  The "percentage probability" wo=
uld most likely 
place your sword in late Ko-to, perhaps early Shin-to, how=
ever, you 
can't rule out the possibility of it being a 13/14th century bla=
de. 
The faint inscription, many polishes, could place it among the very 
f=
ew....    Good luck,      Dave
